briefdescription.para: < frame size in megabits.

detaileddescription.para: For performance measurement.

briefdescription.para: < number of dimensions
< number of extra virtual dimensions
< Array of current dimension sizes.

detaileddescription.para: This updates as various dimensions grow.

briefdescription.para: < Array of maximum dimension sizes.

detaileddescription.para: The value -1 is HDF5 term for infinite.

briefdescription.para: < Array of chunk size in each dimension.

detaileddescription.para: Only the dimensions that indicate the frame size (width, height) can really be tweaked. All other dimensions should be set to 1.

briefdescription.para: < Array of current offset in each dimension.

detaileddescription.para: The frame dimensions always have 0 offset but additional dimensions may grow as new frames are added.

briefdescription.para: < The frame size in each dimension.

detaileddescription.para: Frame width, height and possibly depth (RGB) have real values -all other dimensions set to 1.

briefdescription.para: < The desired sizes of the extra (virtual) dimensions: {Y, X, n}
Array of strings with human readable names for each dimension.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *portName, int queueSize, int blockingCallbacks, const char *NDArrayPort, int NDArrayAddr, int priority, int stackSize)
memberdef.name: NDFileHDF5

briefdescription.para: Constructor for NDFileHDF5; parameters are identical to those for NDPluginFile::NDPluginFile, and are passed directly to that base class constructor.

detaileddescription.para: After calling the base class constructor this method sets NDPluginFile::supportsMultipleArrays=1.

briefdescription.para: Opens a HDF5 file.

detaileddescription.para:
In write mode if NDFileModeMultiple is set then the first dataspace dimension is set to H5S_UNLIMITED to allow multiple arrays to be written to the same file. NOTE: Does not currently support NDFileModeRead or NDFileModeAppend.
fileName
Absolute path name of the file to open.
openMode
Bit mask with one of the access mode bits NDFileModeRead, NDFileModeWrite, NDFileModeAppend. May also have the bit NDFileModeMultiple set if the file is to be opened to write or read multiple NDArrays into a single file.
pArray
Pointer to an NDArray; this array is used to determine the header information and data structure for the file.

briefdescription.para: Read NDArray data from a HDF5 file; NOTE: not implemented yet.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the address of an NDArray to read the data into.

briefdescription.para: Writes NDArray data to a HDF5 file.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to an NDArray to write to the file. This function can be called multiple times between the call to openFile and closeFile if NDFileModeMultiple was set in openMode in the call to NDFileHDF5::openFile.

briefdescription.para: Closes the HDF5 file opened with NDFileHDF5::openFile.
Report status of the driver.

detaileddescription.para:
This method calls the report function in the asynPortDriver base class. It then calls the NDArrayPool::report() method if details >5.
fp
File pointed passed by caller where the output is written to.
details
If >5 then NDArrayPool::report and NDAttributeList::report are both called.

briefdescription.para: Perform any actions required when an int32 parameter is updated.
Called when asyn clients call pasynOctet->write().

detaileddescription.para:
This function performs actions for some parameters, including AttributesFile. For all parameters it sets the value in the parameter library and calls any registered callbacks..
pasynUser
pasynUser structure that encodes the reason and address.
value
Address of the string to write.
nChars
Number of characters to write.
nActual
Number of characters actually written.

briefdescription.para: Thread function for flush now command Waits for flush events, and upon receiving one, flushes all datasets and attributes, ensuring that the unique ID attribute is the last attribute flushed.
Create the groups and datasets in the HDF5 file.
Check through attributes and store any that have been marked as onOpen.
Check through attributes and store any that have been marked as onClose.
Check attribute and store if marked as onOpen or onClose when opening or closing.
Create the root group and recursively create all subgroups and datasets in the HDF5 file.
Create the hardlinks in the HDF5 file.

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &name, const std::string &str_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5dsetStr

briefdescription.para: Write a string constant dataset.

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &name, const std::string &str_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5dsetInt32

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &name, const std::string &str_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5dsetFloat64

briefdescription.para: Check this element for any attached attributes and write them out.

detaileddescription.para: Supported types are 'string', 'int' and 'float'.
The types 'int' and 'float' can contain 1D arrays, where each element is separated by a ','

briefdescription.para: Create the dataset and write it out.

detaileddescription.para: Only detector and constant datasets are created in the file out at this time.
NDAttribute datasets are created elsewhere in createAttributeDatasets()

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &attr_name, const std::string &str_attr_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5attrStr

briefdescription.para: Write a string constant attribute.

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &attr_name, const std::string &str_attr_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5attrInt32

briefdescription.para: Write an int (or array of ints) constant attribute.

memberdef.argsstring: (hid_t element, const std::string &attr_name, const std::string &str_attr_value) const
memberdef.name: writeH5attrFloat64

briefdescription.para: Write a float (or array of floats) constant attribute.
Utility method to convert from hdf5 to hid datatype.
Create a dataset in the HDF5 file with the details defined in the dset argument.

detaileddescription.para: Return the hid_t handle to the new dataset on success; -1 on error. Errors: fail to set chunk size or failure to create the dataset in the file.

briefdescription.para: Check if the specified filename/path exists.
Verify the XML layout file is valid.

detaileddescription.para: This method checks the file exists and can be opened. If these checks pass then the file is opened and the XML is also parsed and verified. Any error messages are reported and the status set accordingly. This must be called with the lock already taken.

briefdescription.para: Return the requested dimension size.
Return the requested max dimension size.
Return the requested chunk dimension size.
Return the requested offset size.
Return the requested virtual dimension size.
Configure the HDF5 dimension definitions based on NDArray dimensions.

detaileddescription.para: Initially this implementation just copies the dimension sizes from the NDArray in the same order. A last infinite length dimension is added if multiple frames are to be stored in the same file (in Capture or Stream mode).

briefdescription.para: Calculate the total number of frames that the current configured dimensions can contain.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the NDFileNumCapture parameter to the total value so file saving will complete at this number. This is called only from writeInt32 so the lock is already taken.

briefdescription.para: Set the multi frame parameter.

parameterdescription.para: boolean to set the writer frame mode

briefdescription.para: Translate the NDArray datatype to HDF5 datatypes.
Configure the required dimensions for a dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This method will call the configureDims method for each detector dataset created.

briefdescription.para: Configure the required compression for a dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This method will call the configureCompression method for each detector dataset created. To enable compression via the HDF5 pipeline, it is sufficient to call this method with just a name. This will cause the chunking verification to fail so that direct chunk write is not used. To configure the dataset to direct chunk write pre-compressed data, the full codec definition must be provided and match the NDArrays passed in.

briefdescription.para: Configure compression.
Iterate through all the local stored dimension information.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a string where each line is an ASCII report of the value for each dimension. Intended for development and debugging. This function is not thread safe.

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to write a null terminated string as an HDF5 attribute to an HDF5 element (group or dataset)
Write the NDArray attributes to the file.
Close all attribute datasets and clear out memory.
Setup the required allocation for the performance dataset.
Create the dataset required for performance data.
Write out the performance dataset.
find out whether or not the input is a prime number.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if number is a prime. False if not.

briefdescription.para: Add the default attributes from NDArrays into the local NDAttribute list.

detaileddescription.para: The relevant attributes are: uniqueId, timeStamp, epicsTS.secPastEpoch and epicsTS.nsec.

briefdescription.para: Add the default attributes from NDArrays as HDF5 attributes on the detector datasets.
Create the output file layout as specified by the XML layout.
Create the group of datasets to hold the NDArray attributes.
Writes NDArrays in the HDF5 file format; an XML file can control the structure of the HDF5 file.
